newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks firm in London, HSBC gains.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks firm in London, HSBC gains.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks in London edged higher in quiet trading on Tuesday, tracking strength in U.S. Treasury bonds and the UK's FTSE 100 index.
The Hang Seng London Reference Index was up 4.21 points by 1420 GMT at 11,925.43, extending a firm close in Hong Kong which saw the Hang Seng index ending at a 31-month high of 11,921.22.
Yet traders said activity in London was confined to a small number of stocks.

While Sun Hung Kai Properties was up 20 HK cents at HK$82.32-1/2 ahead of tomorrow's year-end results, HSBC Holdings provided the main focus of interest, up 87-1/2 HK cents from their Hong Kong close at HK$144.37-1/2.
"They are the only thing that's moved, probably on the back of strength in the FTSE," said one trader.
The U.S. long bond was up 7/16 at 98-3/16, reducing its yield to 6.89 percent, buoyed by a drop in the September National Association of Purchasing Managers index.
